title: What are the most important critical race theory books? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve read a fair amount of books in this subject and have a set of texts that I’ve either really enjoyed or gotten repeated recommendations for - so this is by no means a complete list, but I think a good introductory one nonetheless: Black Skin, White Masks - Frantz FanonCritical Race Theory: The Key Writings That Formed the Movement - Kimberlé CrenshawCitizen: An American Lyric - Claudia RankinePlaying in the Dark: Whiteness and the Literary Imagination - Toni MorrisonSister Outsider: Essays and Speeches - Audre LordePedagogy of the Oppressed - Paulo FreireAin't I a Woman: Black Women and Feminism - bell hooksThe Wretched of the Earth - Frantz FanonWomen, Race, and Class - Angela DavisThis Bridge Called My Back: Writings by Radical Women of Color - Cherríe L. Moraga & Gloria E. Anzaldúa

Mein Kampf is an absolute masterpiece of the discipline. It describes how a beautiful, pure racial minority can be oppressed by a more powerful group. ATTENTION: THE PRECEDING MESSAGE IS SATIRE. IT IS INTENDED TO MOCK CRITICAL RACE THEORY AND IS NOT MEANT AS AN ACTUAL RECOMMENDATION THAT YOU READ MEIN KAMPF, OR EVEN ITS COMPANION CHILDREN'S VOLUME, MEIN KAMPFY CHAIR: HOW RECLINERS COUNTER THE OMNIPRESENT THREAT OF INTERNATIONAL JEWRY. HAD THIS BEEN AN ACTUAL POST SUPPORTING CRITICAL RACE THEORY, IT WOULD HAVE SEVERAL THOUSAND UPVOTES AND INCLUDE THE WORDS “KILL WHITEY.” I'M THE GHOST OF JONATHAN SWIFT AND I APPROVE THIS MESSAGE.
